message:
The first build worked.  Then I deployed.  Added something and ran the build again...

Wills-Mac-Pro:sifted02 Gibson$ middleman build
/Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/middleman-2.0.14/bin/middleman:51:in `require': no such file to load -- middleman (LoadError)
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/middleman-2.0.14/bin/middleman:51:in `start_cli!'
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/middleman-2.0.14/bin/middleman:47:in `did_locate_middleman_project'
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/middleman-2.0.14/bin/middleman:20:in `locate_middleman_root!'
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/middleman-2.0.14/bin/middleman:70:in `<top (required)>'
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/bin/middleman:19:in `load'
	from /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/versions/1.9.2-p290/bin/middleman:19:in `<main>'
and now the local server won't fire up.  Clearly I broke something.  Hah.
Are you using Bundler? If not, looks like the middleman gem got lost. Does re-installing it (gem install middleman) help? Rbenv keeps separate gems for each version of ruby

I'm super confused.  The gem is there in /Users/Gibson/.rbenv/shims/gem

middleman (2.0.14)
middleman-blog (0.1.5, 0.1.4)

But reinstalling the gem didn't help.  It's only doing this on that specific middleman blog folder.  I have another one that works fine but I can't seem to replicate what I did that made it crap out.
Seeming like a Rbenv issue. Are you using different .rbenv-version files in different projects?
